snippet: Regulators put muni issuers on notice about disclosing basic financial information, but some don’t seem to have gotten the message, and the regulators don’t seem to care.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column contends that the $4 trillion municipal bonds market is stuck in the Dark Ages; notes that regulators put muni issuers on notice in 2009 about disclosing basic financial information, but some do not seem to have gotten the message, and the regulators do not seem to care; relates the troubled history of issuer West Penn Allegheny Health System.
lead_paragraph: Regulators put muni issuers on notice about disclosing basic financial information, but some don’t seem to have gotten the message, and the regulators don’t seem to care.
